rules.name: java/netty-http-response-splitting
rules.description: Disabling HTTP header validation makes code vulnerable to attack by header splitting if user input is written directly to an HTTP header.

rules.name: java/http-response-splitting
rules.description: Writing user input directly to an HTTP header makes code vulnerable to attack by header splitting.

rules.name: java/insecure-cookie
rules.description: Insecure cookies may be sent in cleartext, which makes them vulnerable to interception.

rules.name: java/tainted-permissions-check
rules.shortDescription: User-controlled data used in permissions check
rules.description: Using user-controlled data in a permissions check may result in inappropriate permissions being granted.

rules.name: java/concatenated-sql-query
rules.shortDescription: Query built without neutralizing special characters
rules.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query without escaping or otherwise neutralizing any special characters is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code.

rules.name: java/sql-injection
rules.description: Building a SQL or Java Persistence query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

rules.name: java/tainted-numeric-cast
rules.description: Casting user-controlled numeric data to a narrower type without validation can cause unexpected truncation.

rules.name: java/maven/non-https-url
rules.shortDescription: Failure to use HTTPS or SFTP URL in Maven artifact upload/download
rules.description: Non-HTTPS connections can be intercepted by third parties.

rules.name: java/world-writable-file-read
rules.shortDescription: Reading from a world writable file
rules.description: Reading from a file which is set as world writable is dangerous because the file may be modified or removed by external actors.

rules.name: java/spring-disabled-csrf-protection
rules.description: Disabling CSRF protection makes the application vulnerable to a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack.

rules.name: java/concatenated-command-line
rules.shortDescription: Building a command line with string concatenation
rules.description: Using concatenated strings in a command line is vulnerable to malicious insertion of special characters in the strings.

rules.name: java/command-line-injection
rules.description: Using externally controlled strings in a command line is vulnerable to malicious changes in the strings.

rules.name: java/stack-trace-exposure
rules.shortDescription: Information exposure through a stack trace
rules.description: Information from a stack trace propagates to an external user. Stack traces can unintentionally reveal implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.

rules.name: java/zipslip
rules.shortDescription: Arbitrary file write during archive extraction ("Zip Slip")
rules.description: Extracting files from a malicious archive without validating that the destination file path is within the destination directory can cause files outside the destination directory to be overwritten.

rules.name: java/path-injection
rules.shortDescription: Uncontrolled data used in path expression
rules.description: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.

rules.name: java/unvalidated-url-redirection
rules.description: URL redirection based on unvalidated user-input may cause redirection to malicious web sites.

rules.name: java/ldap-injection
rules.shortDescription: LDAP query built from user-controlled sources
rules.description: Building an LDAP query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious LDAP code by the user.

rules.name: java/predictable-seed
rules.shortDescription: Use of a predictable seed in a secure random number generator
rules.description: Using a predictable seed in a pseudo-random number generator can lead to predictability of the numbers generated by it.

rules.name: java/tainted-format-string
rules.description: Using external input in format strings can lead to exceptions or information leaks.

rules.name: java/cleartext-storage-in-cookie
rules.shortDescription: Cleartext storage of sensitive information in cookie
rules.description: Storing sensitive information in cleartext can expose it to an attacker.

rules.name: java/unsafe-deserialization
rules.description: Deserializing user-controlled data may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code.

rules.name: java/xss
rules.description: Writing user input directly to a web page allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

rules.name: java/xxe
rules.shortDescription: Resolving XML external entity in user-controlled data
rules.description: Parsing user-controlled XML documents and allowing expansion of external entity references may lead to disclosure of confidential data or denial of service.

rules.name: java/integer-multiplication-cast-to-long
rules.shortDescription: Result of multiplication cast to wider type
rules.description: Casting the result of a multiplication to a wider type instead of casting before the multiplication may cause overflow.

rules.name: java/implicit-cast-in-compound-assignment
rules.shortDescription: Implicit narrowing conversion in compound assignment
rules.description: Compound assignment statements (for example 'intvar += longvar') that implicitly cast a value of a wider type to a narrower type may result in information loss and numeric errors such as overflows.

rules.name: js/angular/disabling-sce
rules.description: Disabling strict contextual escaping (SCE) can cause security vulnerabilities.

rules.name: js/angular/insecure-url-whitelist
rules.description: URL whitelists that are too permissive can cause security vulnerabilities.

rules.name: js/disabling-electron-websecurity
rules.description: Disabling webSecurity can cause critical security vulnerabilities.

rules.name: js/enabling-electron-insecure-content
rules.description: Enabling allowRunningInsecureContent can allow remote code execution.

rules.name: js/prototype-pollution-utility
rules.description: Recursively assigning properties on objects may cause accidental modification of a built-in prototype object.

rules.name: js/prototype-pollution
rules.description: Recursively merging a user-controlled object into another object can allow an attacker to modify the built-in Object prototype.

rules.name: js/insecure-randomness
rules.description: Using a cryptographically weak pseudo-random number generator to generate a security-sensitive value may allow an attacker to predict what value will be generated.

rules.name: js/unvalidated-dynamic-method-call
rules.description: Calling a method with a user-controlled name may dispatch to an unexpected target, which could cause an exception.

rules.name: js/incomplete-multi-character-sanitization
rules.description: A sanitizer that removes a sequence of characters may reintroduce the dangerous sequence.

rules.name: js/double-escaping
rules.description: When escaping special characters using a meta-character like backslash or ampersand, the meta-character has to be escaped first to avoid double-escaping, and conversely it has to be unescaped last to avoid double-unescaping.

rules.name: js/incomplete-sanitization
rules.description: A string transformer that does not replace or escape all occurrences of a meta-character may be ineffective.

rules.name: js/incomplete-html-attribute-sanitization
rules.description: Writing incompletely sanitized values to HTML attribute strings can lead to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

rules.name: js/unsafe-html-expansion
rules.shortDescription: Unsafe expansion of self-closing HTML tag
rules.description: Using regular expressions to expand self-closing HTML tags may lead to cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

rules.name: js/host-header-forgery-in-email-generation
rules.shortDescription: Host header poisoning in email generation
rules.description: Using the HTTP Host header to construct a link in an email can facilitate phishing attacks and leak password reset tokens.

rules.name: js/sql-injection
rules.shortDescription: Database query built from user-controlled sources
rules.description: Building a database query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

rules.name: js/hardcoded-credentials
rules.description: Hard-coding credentials in source code may enable an attacker to gain unauthorized access.

rules.name: js/type-confusion-through-parameter-tampering
rules.description: Sanitizing an HTTP request parameter may be ineffective if the user controls its type.

rules.name: js/exposure-of-private-files
rules.description: Exposing a node_modules folder, or the project folder to the public, can cause exposure of private information.

rules.name: js/missing-rate-limiting
rules.description: An HTTP request handler that performs expensive operations without restricting the rate at which operations can be carried out is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

rules.name: js/regex-injection
rules.description: User input should not be used in regular expressions without first being escaped, otherwise a malicious user may be able to inject an expression that could require exponential time on certain inputs.

rules.name: js/insecure-download
rules.shortDescription: Download of sensitive file through insecure connection
rules.description: Downloading executables and other sensitive files over an insecure connection opens up for potential man-in-the-middle attacks.

rules.name: js/weak-cryptographic-algorithm
rules.shortDescription: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic algorithm
rules.description: Using broken or weak cryptographic algorithms can compromise security.

rules.name: js/biased-cryptographic-random
rules.shortDescription: Creating biased random numbers from a cryptographically secure source.
rules.description: Some mathematical operations on random numbers can cause bias in the results and compromise security.

rules.name: js/xml-bomb
rules.description: Parsing user input as an XML document with arbitrary internal entity expansion is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

rules.name: js/missing-token-validation
rules.description: Using cookies without CSRF protection may allow malicious websites to submit requests on behalf of the user.

rules.name: js/code-injection
rules.description: Interpreting unsanitized user input as code allows a malicious user arbitrary code execution.

rules.name: js/unsafe-dynamic-method-access
rules.description: Invoking user-controlled methods on certain objects can lead to remote code execution.

rules.name: js/bad-code-sanitization
rules.description: Escaping code as HTML does not provide protection against code injection.

rules.name: js/cross-window-information-leak
rules.shortDescription: Cross-window communication with unrestricted target origin
rules.description: When sending sensitive information to another window using `postMessage`, the origin of the target window should be restricted to avoid unintentional information leaks.

rules.name: js/cors-misconfiguration-for-credentials
rules.description: Misconfiguration of CORS HTTP headers allows for leaks of secret credentials.

rules.name: js/shell-command-injection-from-environment
rules.shortDescription: Shell command built from environment values
rules.description: Building a shell command string with values from the enclosing environment may cause subtle bugs or vulnerabilities.

rules.name: js/shell-command-constructed-from-input
rules.shortDescription: Unsafe shell command constructed from library input
rules.description: Using externally controlled strings in a command line may allow a malicious user to change the meaning of the command.

rules.name: js/unnecessary-use-of-cat
rules.description: Using the `cat` process to read a file is unnecessarily complex, inefficient, unportable, and can lead to subtle bugs, or even security vulnerabilities.

rules.name: js/command-line-injection
rules.description: Using externally controlled strings in a command line may allow a malicious user to change the meaning of the command.

rules.name: js/insufficient-password-hash
rules.shortDescription: Use of password hash with insufficient computational effort
rules.description: Creating a hash of a password with low computational effort makes the hash vulnerable to password cracking attacks.

rules.name: js/stack-trace-exposure
rules.shortDescription: Information exposure through a stack trace
rules.description: Propagating stack trace information to an external user can unintentionally reveal implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.

rules.name: js/zipslip
rules.shortDescription: Arbitrary file write during zip extraction ("Zip Slip")
rules.description: Extracting files from a malicious zip archive without validating that the destination file path is within the destination directory can cause files outside the destination directory to be overwritten.

rules.name: js/path-injection
rules.shortDescription: Uncontrolled data used in path expression
rules.description: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.

rules.name: js/disabling-certificate-validation
rules.description: Disabling cryptographic certificate validation can cause security vulnerabilities.

rules.name: js/client-side-unvalidated-url-redirection
rules.description: Client-side URL redirection based on unvalidated user input may cause redirection to malicious web sites.

rules.name: js/server-side-unvalidated-url-redirection
rules.description: Server-side URL redirection based on unvalidated user input may cause redirection to malicious web sites.

rules.name: js/loop-bound-injection
rules.description: Iterating over an object with a user-controlled .length property can cause indefinite looping.

rules.name: js/incorrect-suffix-check
rules.description: Using indexOf to implement endsWith functionality is error-prone if the -1 case is not explicitly handled.

rules.name: js/incomplete-url-scheme-check
rules.description: Checking for the "javascript:" URL scheme without also checking for "vbscript:" and "data:" suggests a logic error or even a security vulnerability.

rules.name: js/useless-regexp-character-escape
rules.description: Prepending a backslash to an ordinary character in a string does not have any effect, and may make regular expressions constructed from this string behave unexpectedly.

rules.name: js/incomplete-url-substring-sanitization
rules.description: Security checks on the substrings of an unparsed URL are often vulnerable to bypassing.

rules.name: js/incomplete-hostname-regexp
rules.description: Matching a URL or hostname against a regular expression that contains an unescaped dot as part of the hostname might match more hostnames than expected.

rules.name: js/xpath-injection
rules.description: Building an XPath expression from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

rules.name: js/tainted-format-string
rules.description: Using external input in format strings can lead to garbled output.

rules.name: js/clear-text-storage-of-sensitive-data
rules.shortDescription: Clear text storage of sensitive information
rules.description: Sensitive information stored without encryption or hashing can expose it to an attacker.

rules.name: js/clear-text-logging
rules.description: Logging sensitive information without encryption or hashing can expose it to an attacker.

rules.name: js/build-artifact-leak
rules.shortDescription: Storage of sensitive information in build artifact
rules.description: Including sensitive information in a build artifact can expose it to an attacker.

rules.name: js/unsafe-deserialization
rules.description: Deserializing user-controlled data may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code.

rules.name: js/stored-xss
rules.description: Using uncontrolled stored values in HTML allows for a stored cross-site scripting vulnerability.

rules.name: js/reflected-xss
rules.description: Writing user input directly to an HTTP response allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

rules.name: js/xss-through-exception
rules.description: Reinterpreting text from an exception as HTML can lead to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

rules.name: js/unsafe-jquery-plugin
rules.description: A jQuery plugin that unintentionally constructs HTML from some of its options may be unsafe to use for clients.

rules.name: js/xss-through-dom
rules.description: Reinterpreting text from the DOM as HTML can lead to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

rules.name: js/xss
rules.description: Writing user input directly to the DOM allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

rules.name: js/xxe
rules.description: Parsing user input as an XML document with external entity expansion is vulnerable to XXE attacks.

rules.name: js/unsafe-external-link
rules.description: External links that open in a new tab or window but do not specify link type 'noopener' or 'noreferrer' are a potential security risk.

rules.name: js/identity-replacement
rules.shortDescription: Replacement of a substring with itself
rules.description: Replacing a substring with itself has no effect and may indicate a mistake.

rules.name: js/redos
rules.description: A regular expression that requires exponential time to match certain inputs can be a performance bottleneck, and may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

rules.name: js/polynomial-redos
rules.shortDescription: Polynomial regular expression used on uncontrolled data
rules.description: A regular expression that can require polynomial time to match user-provided values may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

cwe-611.name: js/xxe
cwe-611.description: Parsing user input as an XML document with external entity expansion is vulnerable to XXE attacks.

cwe-190.name: java/integer-multiplication-cast-to-long
cwe-190.shortDescription: Result of multiplication cast to wider type
cwe-190.description: Casting the result of a multiplication to a wider type instead of casting before the multiplication may cause overflow.

cwe-190.name: java/implicit-cast-in-compound-assignment
cwe-190.shortDescription: Implicit narrowing conversion in compound assignment
cwe-190.description: Compound assignment statements (for example 'intvar += longvar') that implicitly cast a value of a wider type to a narrower type may result in information loss and numeric errors such as overflows.

cwe-192.name: java/integer-multiplication-cast-to-long
cwe-192.shortDescription: Result of multiplication cast to wider type
cwe-192.description: Casting the result of a multiplication to a wider type instead of casting before the multiplication may cause overflow.

cwe-192.name: java/implicit-cast-in-compound-assignment
cwe-192.shortDescription: Implicit narrowing conversion in compound assignment
cwe-192.description: Compound assignment statements (for example 'intvar += longvar') that implicitly cast a value of a wider type to a narrower type may result in information loss and numeric errors such as overflows.

cwe-183.name: js/angular/insecure-url-whitelist
cwe-183.description: URL whitelists that are too permissive can cause security vulnerabilities.

cwe-625.name: js/angular/insecure-url-whitelist
cwe-625.description: URL whitelists that are too permissive can cause security vulnerabilities.

cwe-400.name: js/prototype-pollution-utility
cwe-400.description: Recursively assigning properties on objects may cause accidental modification of a built-in prototype object.

cwe-400.name: js/prototype-pollution
cwe-400.description: Recursively merging a user-controlled object into another object can allow an attacker to modify the built-in Object prototype.

cwe-400.name: js/missing-rate-limiting
cwe-400.description: An HTTP request handler that performs expensive operations without restricting the rate at which operations can be carried out is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

cwe-400.name: js/regex-injection
cwe-400.description: User input should not be used in regular expressions without first being escaped, otherwise a malicious user may be able to inject an expression that could require exponential time on certain inputs.

cwe-400.name: js/xml-bomb
cwe-400.description: Parsing user input as an XML document with arbitrary internal entity expansion is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

cwe-400.name: js/redos
cwe-400.description: A regular expression that requires exponential time to match certain inputs can be a performance bottleneck, and may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

cwe-400.name: js/polynomial-redos
cwe-400.shortDescription: Polynomial regular expression used on uncontrolled data
cwe-400.description: A regular expression that can require polynomial time to match user-provided values may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

cwe-471.name: js/prototype-pollution-utility
cwe-471.description: Recursively assigning properties on objects may cause accidental modification of a built-in prototype object.

cwe-250.name: js/prototype-pollution
cwe-250.description: Recursively merging a user-controlled object into another object can allow an attacker to modify the built-in Object prototype.

cwe-338.name: js/insecure-randomness
cwe-338.description: Using a cryptographically weak pseudo-random number generator to generate a security-sensitive value may allow an attacker to predict what value will be generated.

cwe-754.name: js/unvalidated-dynamic-method-call
cwe-754.description: Calling a method with a user-controlled name may dispatch to an unexpected target, which could cause an exception.

cwe-116.name: js/incomplete-multi-character-sanitization
cwe-116.description: A sanitizer that removes a sequence of characters may reintroduce the dangerous sequence.

cwe-116.name: js/double-escaping
cwe-116.description: When escaping special characters using a meta-character like backslash or ampersand, the meta-character has to be escaped first to avoid double-escaping, and conversely it has to be unescaped last to avoid double-unescaping.

cwe-116.name: js/incomplete-sanitization
cwe-116.description: A string transformer that does not replace or escape all occurrences of a meta-character may be ineffective.

cwe-116.name: js/incomplete-html-attribute-sanitization
cwe-116.description: Writing incompletely sanitized values to HTML attribute strings can lead to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

cwe-116.name: js/unsafe-html-expansion
cwe-116.shortDescription: Unsafe expansion of self-closing HTML tag
cwe-116.description: Using regular expressions to expand self-closing HTML tags may lead to cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

cwe-116.name: js/code-injection
cwe-116.description: Interpreting unsanitized user input as code allows a malicious user arbitrary code execution.

cwe-116.name: js/bad-code-sanitization
cwe-116.description: Escaping code as HTML does not provide protection against code injection.

cwe-116.name: js/client-side-unvalidated-url-redirection
cwe-116.description: Client-side URL redirection based on unvalidated user input may cause redirection to malicious web sites.

cwe-116.name: js/stored-xss
cwe-116.description: Using uncontrolled stored values in HTML allows for a stored cross-site scripting vulnerability.

cwe-116.name: js/reflected-xss
cwe-116.description: Writing user input directly to an HTTP response allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

cwe-116.name: js/xss-through-exception
cwe-116.description: Reinterpreting text from an exception as HTML can lead to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

cwe-116.name: js/unsafe-jquery-plugin
cwe-116.description: A jQuery plugin that unintentionally constructs HTML from some of its options may be unsafe to use for clients.

cwe-116.name: js/xss-through-dom
cwe-116.description: Reinterpreting text from the DOM as HTML can lead to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

cwe-116.name: js/xss
cwe-116.description: Writing user input directly to the DOM allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

cwe-116.name: js/identity-replacement
cwe-116.shortDescription: Replacement of a substring with itself
cwe-116.description: Replacing a substring with itself has no effect and may indicate a mistake.

cwe-20.name: js/incomplete-multi-character-sanitization
cwe-20.description: A sanitizer that removes a sequence of characters may reintroduce the dangerous sequence.

cwe-20.name: js/double-escaping
cwe-20.description: When escaping special characters using a meta-character like backslash or ampersand, the meta-character has to be escaped first to avoid double-escaping, and conversely it has to be unescaped last to avoid double-unescaping.

cwe-20.name: js/incomplete-sanitization
cwe-20.description: A string transformer that does not replace or escape all occurrences of a meta-character may be ineffective.

cwe-20.name: js/incomplete-html-attribute-sanitization
cwe-20.description: Writing incompletely sanitized values to HTML attribute strings can lead to a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

cwe-20.name: js/useless-regexp-character-escape
cwe-20.description: Prepending a backslash to an ordinary character in a string does not have any effect, and may make regular expressions constructed from this string behave unexpectedly.

cwe-20.name: js/incomplete-url-substring-sanitization
cwe-20.description: Security checks on the substrings of an unparsed URL are often vulnerable to bypassing.

cwe-20.name: js/incomplete-hostname-regexp
cwe-20.description: Matching a URL or hostname against a regular expression that contains an unescaped dot as part of the hostname might match more hostnames than expected.

cwe-640.name: js/host-header-forgery-in-email-generation
cwe-640.shortDescription: Host header poisoning in email generation
cwe-640.description: Using the HTTP Host header to construct a link in an email can facilitate phishing attacks and leak password reset tokens.

cwe-259.name: js/hardcoded-credentials
cwe-259.description: Hard-coding credentials in source code may enable an attacker to gain unauthorized access.

cwe-321.name: js/hardcoded-credentials
cwe-321.description: Hard-coding credentials in source code may enable an attacker to gain unauthorized access.

cwe-798.name: js/hardcoded-credentials
cwe-798.description: Hard-coding credentials in source code may enable an attacker to gain unauthorized access.

cwe-843.name: js/type-confusion-through-parameter-tampering
cwe-843.description: Sanitizing an HTTP request parameter may be ineffective if the user controls its type.

cwe-200.name: js/exposure-of-private-files
cwe-200.description: Exposing a node_modules folder, or the project folder to the public, can cause exposure of private information.

cwe-200.name: js/unsafe-external-link
cwe-200.description: External links that open in a new tab or window but do not specify link type 'noopener' or 'noreferrer' are a potential security risk.

cwe-307.name: js/missing-rate-limiting
cwe-307.description: An HTTP request handler that performs expensive operations without restricting the rate at which operations can be carried out is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

cwe-770.name: js/missing-rate-limiting
cwe-770.description: An HTTP request handler that performs expensive operations without restricting the rate at which operations can be carried out is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

cwe-730.name: js/regex-injection
cwe-730.description: User input should not be used in regular expressions without first being escaped, otherwise a malicious user may be able to inject an expression that could require exponential time on certain inputs.

cwe-730.name: js/redos
cwe-730.description: A regular expression that requires exponential time to match certain inputs can be a performance bottleneck, and may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

cwe-730.name: js/polynomial-redos
cwe-730.shortDescription: Polynomial regular expression used on uncontrolled data
cwe-730.description: A regular expression that can require polynomial time to match user-provided values may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

cwe-327.name: js/weak-cryptographic-algorithm
cwe-327.shortDescription: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic algorithm
cwe-327.description: Using broken or weak cryptographic algorithms can compromise security.

cwe-327.name: js/biased-cryptographic-random
cwe-327.shortDescription: Creating biased random numbers from a cryptographically secure source.
cwe-327.description: Some mathematical operations on random numbers can cause bias in the results and compromise security.

cwe-776.name: js/xml-bomb
cwe-776.description: Parsing user input as an XML document with arbitrary internal entity expansion is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

cwe-094.name: js/code-injection
cwe-094.description: Interpreting unsanitized user input as code allows a malicious user arbitrary code execution.

cwe-094.name: js/unsafe-dynamic-method-access
cwe-094.description: Invoking user-controlled methods on certain objects can lead to remote code execution.

cwe-094.name: js/bad-code-sanitization
cwe-094.description: Escaping code as HTML does not provide protection against code injection.

cwe-201.name: js/cross-window-information-leak
cwe-201.shortDescription: Cross-window communication with unrestricted target origin
cwe-201.description: When sending sensitive information to another window using `postMessage`, the origin of the target window should be restricted to avoid unintentional information leaks.

cwe-359.name: js/cross-window-information-leak
cwe-359.shortDescription: Cross-window communication with unrestricted target origin
cwe-359.description: When sending sensitive information to another window using `postMessage`, the origin of the target window should be restricted to avoid unintentional information leaks.

cwe-359.name: js/clear-text-storage-of-sensitive-data
cwe-359.shortDescription: Clear text storage of sensitive information
cwe-359.description: Sensitive information stored without encryption or hashing can expose it to an attacker.

cwe-359.name: js/clear-text-logging
cwe-359.description: Logging sensitive information without encryption or hashing can expose it to an attacker.

cwe-359.name: js/build-artifact-leak
cwe-359.shortDescription: Storage of sensitive information in build artifact
cwe-359.description: Including sensitive information in a build artifact can expose it to an attacker.

cwe-346.name: js/cors-misconfiguration-for-credentials
cwe-346.description: Misconfiguration of CORS HTTP headers allows for leaks of secret credentials.

cwe-639.name: js/cors-misconfiguration-for-credentials
cwe-639.description: Misconfiguration of CORS HTTP headers allows for leaks of secret credentials.

cwe-916.name: js/insufficient-password-hash
cwe-916.shortDescription: Use of password hash with insufficient computational effort
cwe-916.description: Creating a hash of a password with low computational effort makes the hash vulnerable to password cracking attacks.

cwe-099.name: js/path-injection
cwe-099.shortDescription: Uncontrolled data used in path expression
cwe-099.description: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.

cwe-834.name: js/loop-bound-injection
cwe-834.description: Iterating over an object with a user-controlled .length property can cause indefinite looping.

cwe-020.name: js/incorrect-suffix-check
cwe-020.description: Using indexOf to implement endsWith functionality is error-prone if the -1 case is not explicitly handled.

cwe-020.name: js/incomplete-url-scheme-check
cwe-020.description: Checking for the "javascript:" URL scheme without also checking for "vbscript:" and "data:" suggests a logic error or even a security vulnerability.

cwe-643.name: js/xpath-injection
cwe-643.description: Building an XPath expression from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious code by the user.

cwe-312.name: js/clear-text-storage-of-sensitive-data
cwe-312.shortDescription: Clear text storage of sensitive information
cwe-312.description: Sensitive information stored without encryption or hashing can expose it to an attacker.

cwe-312.name: js/clear-text-logging
cwe-312.description: Logging sensitive information without encryption or hashing can expose it to an attacker.

cwe-312.name: js/build-artifact-leak
cwe-312.shortDescription: Storage of sensitive information in build artifact
cwe-312.description: Including sensitive information in a build artifact can expose it to an attacker.

cwe-827.name: js/xxe
cwe-827.description: Parsing user input as an XML document with external entity expansion is vulnerable to XXE attacks.

cwe-1022.name: js/unsafe-external-link
cwe-1022.description: External links that open in a new tab or window but do not specify link type 'noopener' or 'noreferrer' are a potential security risk.
